Line 37: Line 37:
Every year parades are held in Wales to commemorate St. David. The largest of these is held in [[Cardiff]].<ref>[http://www.stdavidsday.org St. David's Day Parade Cardiff-Gorymdaith Gwyl Dewi Sant Caerdydd] â Official Site for the St David's Day Parade in Cardiff, [[Wales]]</ref>
Every year parades are held in Wales to commemorate St. David. The largest of these is held in [[Cardiff]].<ref>[http://www.stdavidsday.org St. David's Day Parade Cardiff-Gorymdaith Gwyl Dewi Sant Caerdydd] â Official Site for the St David's Day Parade in Cardiff, [[Wales]]</ref>
â
To mark St. David's Day, and their return from a six-month tour of Afghanistan, soldiers from the [[Royal Welsh Regiment]] provided [[Guard Mounting|The Changing of the Guard]] ceremony at [[Cardiff Castle|Cardiff Castleâs]] south gate on 27 and 28 February 2010.<ref name="Dewi Sant 3">{{cite news|title=WalesOnline - CardiffOnline - Cardiff news - Soldiers go marching on for St Davidâs Day|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/cardiffonline/cardiff-news/40/03/01/soldiers-go-marching-on-for-st-david-s-day-91466-25933023/|accessdate=2010-03-02|publisher=[[Media Wales Ltd]]|date=01 March 2010|work=[[WalesOnline]] website}}</ref>
+
To mark St. David's Day, and their return from a six-month tour of Afghanistan, soldiers from the [[Royal Welsh Regiment]] provided [[Guard Mounting|The Changing of the Guard]] ceremony at [[Cardiff Castle|Cardiff Castleâs]] south gate on 27 and 28 February 2010.<ref name="Dewi Sant 3">{{cite news|title=WalesOnline - CardiffOnline - Cardiff news - Soldiers go marching on for St Davidâs Day|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/cardiffonline/cardiff-news/2010/03/01/soldiers-go-marching-on-for-st-david-s-day-91466-25933023/|accessdate=2010-03-02|publisher=[[Media Wales Ltd]]|date=01 March 2010|work=[[WalesOnline]] website}}</ref>
On 1 March 2010, the seventh National St Davidâs Day Parade took place in [[Cardiff city centre]]. Celebrations included concerts, a parade and a food festival. The food festival ran from 26 February with the third annual Really Welsh Food Festival in [[Queen Street]], featuring all Welsh produce.<ref name="Dewi Sant 11">{{cite news|title=WalesOnline - News - Wales news - Cardiffâs St Davidâs Day celebrations|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/2010/02/12/cardiff-s-st-david-s-day-celebrations-91466-25818369/accessdate=2010-03-02|publisher=[[Media Wales Ltd]]|date=12 February 2010|work=[[WalesOnline]] website}}</ref><ref name="Dewi Sant 2">{{cite news|title=WalesOnline - CardiffOnline - Cardiff news - Sun shines on St Davidâs Day parade|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/cardiffonline/cardiff-news/2010/03/02/sun-shines-on-st-david-s-day-parade-91466-25939808/|accessdate=2010-03-02|publisher=[[Media Wales Ltd]]|date=02 March 2010|work=[[WalesOnline]] website}}</ref> Following the parade, a number of Welsh entertainers performed from a bandstand and in the evening [[Cardiff Central Library]] provided free entertainment and food.<ref name="Dewi Sant 2"/>
On 1 March 2010, the seventh National St Davidâs Day Parade took place in [[Cardiff city centre]]. Celebrations included concerts, a parade and a food festival. The food festival ran from 26 February with the third annual Really Welsh Food Festival in [[Queen Street]], featuring all Welsh produce.<ref name="Dewi Sant 11">{{cite news|title=WalesOnline - News - Wales news - Cardiffâs St Davidâs Day celebrations|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/2010/02/12/cardiff-s-st-david-s-day-celebrations-91466-25818369/accessdate=2010-03-02|publisher=[[Media Wales Ltd]]|date=12 February 2010|work=[[WalesOnline]] website}}</ref><ref name="Dewi Sant 2">{{cite news|title=WalesOnline - CardiffOnline - Cardiff news - Sun shines on St Davidâs Day parade|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/cardiffonline/cardiff-news/2010/03/02/sun-shines-on-st-david-s-day-parade-91466-25939808/|accessdate=2010-03-02|publisher=[[Media Wales Ltd]]|date=02 March 2010|work=[[WalesOnline]] website}}</ref> Following the parade, a number of Welsh entertainers performed from a bandstand and in the evening [[Cardiff Central Library]] provided free entertainment and food.<ref name="Dewi Sant 2"/>
Line 50: Line 50:
[[Swansea]] inaugurated a [[St David's Week]] festival in 2009 with a range of musical, sporting and cultural events held throughout the city to mark the national day.<ref>[http://www.saintdavidsday.com St David's Week in Swansea]</ref>
[[Swansea]] inaugurated a [[St David's Week]] festival in 2009 with a range of musical, sporting and cultural events held throughout the city to mark the national day.<ref>[http://www.saintdavidsday.com St David's Week in Swansea]</ref>
